title: Bitter Cold
opening: After defeating Martel and finding their way out of the forest, The Etrurian Army faced the blizzards common of Ilia’s winters.

Ilia’s harsh climate was a natural defense in itself against invaders. Sigune, flightleader of the Pegasus Knights that had turned to Bern, was preparing to attack Roy, coupled with Ilia’s greatest natural weapon.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Captain! The enemy has arrived. They are on the other side of the mountain.

intro.speaker: Sigune
intro.line: So, they’ve arrived. ...The battle will start soon.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Captain, are you sure?

intro.speaker: Sigune
intro.line: About what?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: The Etrurian Army is saying that will liberate us from Bern. In that case, we could gain independence...

intro.speaker: Sigune
intro.line: Do you really believe what they say? What idiot would fight a war for the sake of others? Once they defeat Bern, they’ll just establish themselves as the next dictator.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Well...

intro.speaker: Sigune
intro.line: Then it’s better to be with Bern. They’re better at warfare.

intro.speaker: Sigune
intro.line: Come now, we have more immediate problems. We’ve got to get rid of the enemy that’s right in front of us first. Are the ballistas ready?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes. The archers are all at their stations.

intro.speaker: Sigune
intro.line: Good! Shoot at them from a distance... They’ll be floundering around in the dark in this powerful blizzard. Observe nature’s wrath...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Such strong wind and hail... I can’t see three meters in front of me.

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: Ilia’s winters are always like this. This is expected if you’re fighting a battle at this time of the year.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: We must attack now so that Bern doesn’t have the time to recover.

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: That’s true. It would be a disaster if the Dark Dragon really was brought back into this world.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I was thinking... Maybe the Dark Dragon is in human form as well.

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: Perhaps. Maybe all the Dragons are in human form now. I’ve also heard stories of Dragons in human form living with people.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Arcadia...

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: Hm? Did you say something?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: No, nothing.

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: I don’t know anything specific, but I’ve read in an ancient scroll that Dragons started taking human form only after the Ending Winter.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: The Ending Winter...

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: You’ve heard about it, right?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes, only in legend. ‘At the Winder of Ends, the laws of nature were turned upside down. Day became night, and summer became winter.'

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: That’s it. These scrolls are so old and damaged so I couldn’t decipher all of them, but one thing is clear. The Ending Winter was a disaster powerful enough to bend and twist the planet.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: What caused it?

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: Who knows... Popular belief says that the laws of nature were twisted when the Dragons unleashed vast amounts of magical power, but I have no idea about what really happened. But it does seem certain that Dragons started taking human form after the Ending Winter. It must be more than coincidence.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes, I agree.

intro.speaker: Niime
intro.line: Well, either way, the truth lies in Bern.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Captain! Other Pegasus Knight squads are headed this way to assist us!

battle.speaker: Sigune
battle.line: Really? That would help. Too bad for the enemy... They’ll be in a panic if they suddenly get attacked from all directions when they can’t see in this snowstorm...

boss.speaker: Sigune
boss.line: So...you made it through this blizzard and cold? Congratulations. But it’s over. You shall end...right here, right now.

boss.speaker: Sigune
boss.line: ...Well, well... So I’m the one...to die... But maybe...I had already died...a long time...ago...

boss.speaker: Sigune
boss.line: You... You’re Juno’s youngest sister. You would fight me?

boss.speaker: Sigune
boss.line: By the honor of an Ilian knight... I won’t go easy on you. All right?

boss.speaker: Sigune
boss.line: Thea? What are you doing here? Oh...you’ve joined the Etrurian side.

boss.speaker: Sigune
boss.line: You know the Ilian knightly code. I won’t go easy on you.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Merlinus, I need you to send this letter to Bishop Yoder in Etruria.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: A letter? May I ask what it says?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It’s the story we heard from Niime about the Dragons.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Oh? What did you discuss with her about the Dragons?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It’ll be long if I tell you. I haven’t sealed the letter yet, so you can look through it if you want.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: All right. Let me see...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Is something wrong, Princess Guinevere?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...I have come to speak about my brother.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ! ...Are you sure?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes... I want you to know before we enter Bern...about the tragedies that have occurred. You asked earlier if my brother murdered the former king.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: In short...it is true.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ! Then King Zephiel indeed killed his own father to seize the throne...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: No!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: No? He didn’t kill his father to get the throne?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: No... Our father was the one who tried to kill Zephiel first.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What!? Then King Zephiel...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: He...couldn’t bear the abuse he was taking from our father. And so he...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What... Why did...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: The Dragons are indeed are mysterious species... Hm? What is the matter?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: No...it is nothing. Perhaps later...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: ...Did I appear at a bad time?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: No, it’s okay. Did you send the letter?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Yes. I read through it, then sealed it and had it sent.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Oh... All right, thanks.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...Why did the former king try to murder his own son...?
